sanskrit_verse:
गत्वा कक्षान्तरं त्वन्यत्समनुज्ञाप्य तं जनम् ।
प्रविशेद्भोजनार्थं च स्त्रीवृतोऽन्तःपुरं पुनः ॥ ७.२२४॥
transliteration:
gatvā kākṣāntaraṃ tv anyat samanujñāpya taṃ janam |
praviśed bhojanārthaṃ ca strīvṛto 'ntaḥpuraṃ punaḥ || 7.224 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who has gone to another chamber, having obtained permission from that person, may again enter the inner apartment accompanied by women for the purpose of taking food.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived through explicit consent and relational alignment
Causation arises through conscious invitation and contextual necessity
Capacity-based responsibility includes honoring prior agreements and spatial boundaries
Restoration logic requires re-entry only upon reaffirmed consent and purpose clarity
Consciousness alignment necessitates harmonizing presence with collective integrity
executable_legal_axioms: IF a person enters a space with prior consent AND exits temporarily, THEN re-entry requires renewed acknowledgment from the host entity.
IF re-entry is for sustenance purposes AND involves female accompaniment, THEN it must align with pre-established household protocols.
IF no objection signal is received within 30 seconds of request, THEN tacit approval is assumed under dharmic continuity.
IF spatial transgression occurs without consent, THEN initiate completion process via guided restitution protocol.
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating disputes concerning domestic access or familial movement rights, the threshold of responsibility lies in verifying the existence of clear, revocable consent. Authority flows from acknowledged relational standing rather than assumed entitlement. The court shall enforce restoration through re-alignment of consent structures, not punitive measures against perceived trespass.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that lawful entry depends on perceptible consent. Anupūrvaśaḥ shows that repeated access without ongoing affirmation disrupts relational harmony. Proportional responsibility rests with the entrant to maintain consent clarity. Non-punitive reality rule affirms that misalignment invites correction through conscious re-integration, not suffering imposition.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Re-establish verbal or gestural consent before re-entry.
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Acknowledge any disruption caused and seek alignment confirmation.
Capacity Restoration: Provide context for necessity of return (e.g., sustenance).
Integrity Reintegration: Engage all involved parties in reaffirming mutual understanding of access norms.
final_declaration: This ruling originates solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma is hereby restored through alignment of conscious consent and relational integrity. Reality remains non-punitive; consciousness alone serves as the ultimate adjudicator.
